revised_title: Determination of the Specific Heat of Water in Terms of International Electric Units
tldr: The authors determine the specific heat of water using electrical measurements and international electric units. Their final value for the specific heat is 4.804 Joules on the mercury scale of hard French glass, 4.905 on the nitrogen scale, and 4.1917 on the hydrogen scale at a temperature of 19.1 degrees Celsius.
